pullrequest.title: Pass through for the comms model.

content.raw:
Here is how I test the bridge.

1. Run simulation: `ign launch cloudsim_sim.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG1 worldName:=tunnel_qual_ign`
2.  Run the bridge: `ign launch cloudsim_bridge.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG1`
3. Run example controller for X1: `roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X1`
4. Run example controller for X2: `roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X2`
5. Send a message from X1 to X2: `rostopic pub /X1/comm std_msgs/String "X2"`. This could case the terminal running the X2 controller to output something similar to:
    ```
[ INFO] [1563654746.385527026]: CommClientCallback
    ```

Then, test that comms still work without the bridge

1. Run simulation: `ign launch competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG1 worldName:=tunnel_qual_ign`
2. Run X1 controller: `roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X1`
3. Run X2 controller: `roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X2`
4. Send a message from X1 to X2: `rostopic pub /X1/comm std_msgs/String "X2"`. This could case the terminal running the X2 controller to output something similar to:
    ```
[ INFO] [1563654746.385527026]: CommClientCallback
    ```
content.html:
Here is how I test the bridge.

  1. Run simulation: ign launch cloudsim_sim.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG1 worldName:=tunnel_qual_ign
  2. Run the bridge: ign launch cloudsim_bridge.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG1
  3. Run example controller for X1: roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X1
  4. Run example controller for X2: roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X2
  5. Send a message from X1 to X2: rostopic pub /X1/comm std_msgs/String "X2". This could case the terminal running the X2 controller to output something similar to: [ INFO] [1563654746.385527026]: CommClientCallback

Then, test that comms still work without the bridge

  1. Run simulation: ign launch competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG1 worldName:=tunnel_qual_ign
  2. Run X1 controller: roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X1
  3. Run X2 controller: roslaunch subt_example example_robot.launch name:=X2
  4. Send a message from X1 to X2: rostopic pub /X1/comm std_msgs/String "X2". This could case the terminal running the X2 controller to output something similar to: [ INFO] [1563654746.385527026]: CommClientCallback
